Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial of L-Ornithine-L-Aspartate in a Rat Model of Hind Limb Ischemia

Trial_Design.evidence: Male Sprague Dawley rats (n=21) were randomly assigned to three groups

Participants.evidence: Male Sprague Dawley rats (n=21) were randomly assigned to three groups

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to three groups: control (normal saline), sorbitol, and LOLA

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of L-Ornithine-L-Aspartate (LOLA) in improving angiogenesis and perfusion in a rat model of hind limb ischemia (HLI).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Perfusion imaging was conducted on PODs 7 and 14.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was stratified by body weight

Number_Randomised.evidence: Male Sprague Dawley rats (n=21) were randomly assigned to three groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: Group 3 (LOLA) showed a significant increase in perfusion recovery (mean difference = 13.77, 95% CI 1.23 to 26.31; p < 0.05)
